item.title: Who is Devajit Saikia? New BCCI secretary who takes charge after Jay Shah’s tenure - Mint
item.description:
Who is Devajit Saikia? New BCCI Secretary Who Takes Charge After Jay Shah’s Tenure

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: Live Mint

Devajit Saikia, a former cricketer, has been appointed as the new secretary of the BCCI following the departure of Jay Shah, who became ICC chairman. Saikia has been serving as interim secretary since December 1.

  • Saikia was officially elected at the BCCI Special General Meeting.
  • Prabhtej Singh Bhatia was also elected as BCCI treasurer, replacing Ashish Shelar.
  • Saikia insists he never intended to be a sports administrator but felt compelled to step in due to corruption issues.
  • A meeting was held with key figures like Rohit Sharma and Gautam Gambhir to discuss the Indian team's performance.
“It was never my intention to be a cricket or sports administrator. Even today I don't like being an administrator.” - Devajit Saikia

The appointment of Saikia signifies a continuity in cricket administration amidst ongoing challenges. His past experience in management and a fresh perspective may prove beneficial for the BCCI as they prepare for upcoming tournaments.

item.title: Watch: Female Fan's Epic Reaction On Spotting Virat Kohli In Public - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Watch: Female Fan's Epic Reaction On Spotting Virat Kohli In Public

Publication Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Star cricketer Virat Kohli was recently spotted at the Gateway of India with his wife Anushka Sharma, where a female fan's enthusiastic reaction to his presence became the highlight of the moment. Despite Kohli’s recent poor performance on the field, his popularity remains strong among fans.

  • Kohli and Anushka were seen enjoying family time in Mumbai.
  • A video capturing the fan's reaction to seeing Kohli went viral on social media.
  • Both Kohli and Anushka visited a priest in Vrindavan earlier, showcasing their devotion.
  • Notable quotes from Anushka highlight her spiritual connection and inner questions addressed during the visit.
“The reaction from the Girl when she saw Virat Kohli was priceless.” — Johns. (@CricCrazyJohns)

The couple's devotion is acknowledged by the priest, indicating its influence on Kohli.

item.title: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli travel to Alibaug from Mumbai, chat as they wait for boat. Watch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli Travel to Alibaug from Mumbai, Chat as They Wait for Boat

Publication Date: Jan 12, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

On Sunday, Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli were seen traveling from Mumbai to Alibaug, sharing moments as they waited for their boat.

  • The couple demonstrated casual style; Anushka wore a white T-shirt with a striped blue shirt and shorts, while Virat donned a black outfit and cap.
  • They interacted with paparazzi and shared a conversation at the jetty.
  • Recently, they visited spiritual leader Premanand Maharaj with their children, reflecting on their previous interactions with him.
  • Anushka expressed a desire for 'prem-bhakti' in her conversation with the guru.
  • The couple celebrated their marriage on December 11, 2017, and have two children: Vamika and Akaay.
“Last time we came, I had some questions in my mind...it felt like I was speaking with you within our own heads.” – Anushka Sharma

This lovely outing showcased their connection, both as a couple and as parents, while also highlighting their spiritual journey.

item.title: Sears and O'Rourke included in New Zealand's Champions Trophy squad - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
New Zealand Champions Trophy Squad Includes Sears and O'Rourke

Publication Date: February 7, 2023 | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

In a significant move, fast bowlers Ben Sears and Will O'Rourke have been named in New Zealand's squad for the upcoming Champions Trophy. The team aims to leverage their skills alongside allrounder Nathan Smith.

  • Sears has potential for his ODI debut, having recovered from injury and shown promise in recent games.
  • O'Rourke is celebrated for his impressive performances across different formats, particularly in Tests.
  • Head coach Gary Stead emphasized Sears's pace as a valuable asset for the challenging conditions in Pakistan.
  • Jacob Duffy was excluded despite a strong season, highlighting the depth of talent in the squad.
  • New Zealand will face Pakistan and South Africa in a tri-series before the Champions Trophy.
“We've been a little conservative in Ben's return to play... we thought he would be part of this Champions Trophy squad.” - Gary Stead

The inclusion of these players underscores New Zealand's strategy to build a robust team for the Champions Trophy and beyond, with a focus on adapting to varying match conditions.

item.title: ICC Champions Trophy 2025: Bangladesh suffer fresh blow after Shakib Al Hasan fails 2nd bowling action test in Chennai - Mint
item.description:
ICC Champions Trophy 2025: Bangladesh suffer fresh blow after Shakib Al Hasan fails 2nd bowling action test in Chennai

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Bangladesh and their star all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan faced another setback for the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025 as Shakib failed his second bowling action test in Chennai. He will be able to play as a batsman but remains suspended from bowling.

  • Shakib was first reported for a suspect bowling action during a match in September.
  • He failed his first test in the UK at Loughborough University on December 15, 2024.
  • The Sri Ramachandra Centre for Sports Science in Chennai confirmed the failure of the second assessment.
  • Captain Najmul Hossain Shanto and BCB president Faruque Ahmed support Shakib's inclusion in the squad.
  • Bangladesh's Champions Trophy campaign begins against India on February 20, requiring squad announcements by January 12.
“A successful reassessment is required for the bowling suspension to be lifted.” - BCB statement

This news adds to the challenges for Bangladesh as they prepare for a crucial tournament, with Shakib's experience being vital despite his ongoing suspension.

item.title: Virat Kohli’s fate hangs on Shubman Gill; Indian stars asked to submit medical if opting out of bilateral series: Report - Mint
item.description:
Virat Kohli’s future dependent on Shubman Gill’s performance amid BCCI meeting

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent BCCI review meeting, discussions centered around Virat Kohli's lackluster performances over the past year, particularly during the recent series against New Zealand and Australia.

  • Kohli's performance has drawn heavy criticism, managing only 93 runs in six innings against New Zealand.
  • In the Border-Gavaskar series in Australia, Kohli scored only 90 runs, aside from a century in Perth.
  • The BCCI is considering Shubman Gill's form as a factor in Kohli's inclusion for the upcoming England series.
  • Players are now required to provide medical reasons if they wish to opt out of bilateral series.
“With the five-Test series against England still five months away, the selectors are likely to sit over the matter before forming an opinion.”

The BCCI's stance indicates a significant change in protocol for players wishing to skip international matches, aiming for greater accountability.

item.title: Aussie pacer faces extended absence after shoulder surgery decision - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Aussie Pacer Faces Extended Absence After Shoulder Surgery Decision

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Australian cricketer Richardson has announced his decision to undergo shoulder surgery to enhance stability and minimize injury risks. This decision will prevent him from completing the season with the Scorchers but is aimed at ensuring a stronger return for the future.

  • Richardson cites limitations due to shoulder issues over the past few years.
  • The surgery aims to improve his performance and decrease the likelihood of future injuries.
  • He acknowledges the difficulty of missing the rest of the season but believes it is necessary for his long-term career.
  • The timing of the surgery is planned to optimize recovery before next summer's Shield cricket.
“While it's a tough call, especially as it means I won't be able to finish the season with the Scorchers, this is the best option to set me up for a strong and healthy return to cricket.”

Richardson expresses gratitude for the support he has received and looks forward to returning stronger for the summer of 2025/2026.

item.title: Reports: Virat Kohli's selection for England tour to depend on Shubman Gill - CricTracker
item.description:
Virat Kohli's Future Depends on Shubman Gill's Performance Ahead of England Tour

Publication Date: January 11, 2023 | Source: CricTracker

Ace India batter Virat Kohli is under increased scrutiny following modest performances in recent matches. His selection for the upcoming England tour will hinge on Shubman Gill's form.

  • Kohli managed only 190 runs in nine innings during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • The All India Men's Senior Selection Committee met to discuss the T20I squad and Kohli's future.
  • Shubman Gill's future performance will influence Kohli's potential place in the Test team.
  • The selectors plan to reassess the situation as the series against England approaches.
  • The 2025 Champions Trophy may be the last for Kohli and Rohit Sharma.
“Shubman Gill hasn’t settled into the Kohli role as he was expected to.” - Hindustan Times

The selectors' decisions regarding Kohli will be closely monitored as the team prepares for upcoming competitions.

item.title: Rohit Sharma Makes Captaincy Promise To BCCI In Meeting, Report Says He Will Quit After... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rohit Sharma's Future as Captain in Question Following BCCI Meeting

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma has discussed his future with the BCCI, indicating he may quit captaincy months ahead following recent defeats including a series loss to Australia.

  • Rohit spoke to BCCI officials, including chief selector Ajit Agarkar and coach Gautam Gambhir.
  • The team has faced disappointing results lately, leading to scrutiny of Rohit's captaincy.
  • He expressed a desire to continue as captain for a few more months while advising the BCCI to seek a successor.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's name emerged as a potential long-term captain despite doubts about his leadership capabilities.
  • Rohit aims to lead the team through the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy before examining his future further.
“I want to remain the team's captain for a few more months.” - Rohit Sharma

Rohit Sharma's imminent decisions bear significant weight on India's cricketing landscape, with potential leadership changes looming on the horizon.
